name: WorldOne
overview:
Headquartered in New York, WorldOne is focused on delivering the highest quality data for the healthcare industry. Our offices are strategically located around the world to provide clients seamless global data collection with local expertise. With 13 years of experience and a premium panel specifically recruited for healthcare data collection, WorldOne provides both online and offline data collection services in more than 80 countries.

Over the past decade, we have greatly expanded on our roots in traditional research methodologies and have played a key role in pioneering global online healthcare research. We were one of the first companies to conduct online data collection in North America, Europe, Asia and Latin America where we provide full-service fieldwork including survey programming, hosting, translation and data processing. Today, true to our innovative spirit, we continue to expand the boundaries of healthcare fieldwork by providing clients access to 1.8 million healthcare professionals around the world.

At WorldOne, the pursuit of excellence is in our DNA. Always looking ahead, challenging ourselves to provide the very best coverage, quality and service, we recently developed a proprietary suite of quality assurance measures called emunity™, which comprises the highest standards in the industry. Also newly launched is WorldOne LIVE, a user-friendly and highly secure client portal that is both a project productivity tool and a global knowledge source.

It’s important to have the right people in the right places. At WorldOne, our internal team of over 350 committed professionals worldwide provides exceptional service and project experience to maximize project results. Since inception, WorldOne has been dedicated to delivering the industry’s leading solutions, always keeping in mind that no matter the methodology, the country, or the respondent type, the final results of any research study are only as reliable as the data collected.

funding_rounds.source_description: WorldOne Receives $25M Investment from Kennet Partners
WorldOne Getting $35M to Expand Sermo Physician Network

acquisitions.source_description: Healthcare innovator Sermo acquired by WorldOne
